intro: Parrya linnaeana, commonly known as the Linnaean parrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. This evergreen shrub typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in woodland or chaparral habitats. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, with a distinctive blue-green coloration. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer.
